New Records: Darius Garland scored a season-high 40 points for the Cleveland Cavaliers, setting a new personal record in the game against the Toronto Raptors.
Key Match Events: Jarrett Allen dove into the courtside seats to recover a crucial rebound with 1:02 remaining, helping the Cavaliers maintain their lead. Darius Garland sealed the win with a key three-pointer that extended the Cavaliers' lead to 129-124 in the final minutes.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland Cavaliers coach Kenny Atkinson described the game against the Toronto Raptors as a 'trap game' due to the back-to-back schedule, but the Cavaliers managed to overcome the challenge despite the initial struggles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cleveland Cavaliers extended their win streak to 12 with the victory, improving to 33-4 on the season. The team also boasts the best home record in the NBA at 20-1. The Toronto Raptors, struggling on the road with a league-worst 1-17 record, continued their poor performance with a loss to the Cavaliers.
Others: The game was notable for the Cavaliers' strong fourth-quarter performance, outscoring the Raptors by 34-23, and the Raptors' early dominance with 12-of-13 shooting, including 8 three-pointers, in the third quarter.
